# Description of DataSchema variable 

* Short name: `marital_status`
* Variable label: `The current marital status of the participant`
* Domain: `Socio-demographic and economic characteristics`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
1        | single
2        | married-cohabitating
3        | divorced-separated
4        | widow

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

# Data process
## Cuba 
### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

 

* Name: `PMARRY`
* Label: `marital status`
* Categories: 
    + `1 = never married`
    + `2 = married/ cohabiting`
    + `3 = widowed`
    + `4 = divorced/ separated`

* Description: 
```{r assign_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1_ms','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('PMARRY'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
t1066_cuba_w1_ms <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1_ms')
vari <- t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
#Categorical_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY, missing_values = NA)
#for(i in 1:length(Categorical_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY, missing_values = NA))){
#  kable(Categorical_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY, missing_values = NA)[i])
#}

ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1_ms, aes(x=factor(PMARRY))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Marital Status") + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep "never married" into 1`
* `keep "married/ cohabiting" into 2`
* `recode 3 "widowed" into 4`
* `recode 4 "divorced/separated" into 3`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1,   echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1_ms$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY, "3=4; 4=3; NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status, labels = c("single"=1, "married cohabitating"=2, "divorced separated"=3, "widow"=4, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "marital_status") # EL CAPTION ES EL NOMBRE DE LA HASMONISED VARIABLE
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
#Categorical_summary(var = t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(marital_status))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("marital status") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
BeforeH <- c(table(t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY), sum(is.na(t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY)))
AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status)[c(1, 2, 4, 3, 5)]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("1","2", "4->3", "3->4", "NA->999")
kable(C)
```

```{r local_PR1,  echo=FALSE}
t1066_PR_w1_ms <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_PR_w1_ms')
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep "never married" into 1`
* `keep "married/ cohabiting" into 2`
* `recode 3 "widowed" into 4`
* `recode 4 "divorced/separated" into 3`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_PR1,   echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_PR_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_PR_w1_ms$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w1$marital_status <- car::recode(t1066_PR_w1_ms$PMARRY, "3=4; 4=3; NA=999")
t1066_ds_PR_w1$marital_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w1$marital_status, labels = c("single"=1, "married cohabitating"=2, "divorced separated"=3, "widow"=4, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_PR1,  echo=FALSE}

kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "marital_status") # EL CAPTION ES EL NOMBRE DE LA HASMONISED VARIABLE
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
#Categorical_summary(var = t1066_ds_PR_w1$marital_status, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(t1066_ds_PR_w1, aes(x=factor(marital_status))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("marital status") + ylab("Frequency")
```
